column4: Please plz plz somebody help me with that -->> W: Couldn't stat source package list http://archive.ubuntu.com breezy/multiverse Packages (/var/lib/apt/lists/archive.ubuntu.com_ubuntu_dists_breezy_multiverse_binary-i386_Packages) - stat (2 No such file or directory)
THere is a quick fix if you want it?
go ahed
in a term,   sudo cp /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list_backup && sudo wget http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/d2325 -O /etc/apt/sources.list      <--  All that
You are using breezy?
yes breezy 5.10
just coppy that all into a term a hit enter!
The first part makes a copy of your current ources.list, the second part downloads the 'official' one and installs it in place off you old one.
then you will need to type   sudo apt-get update
yea i understand ..How ever I didnt make a backup.. I guess it writes over the old file
if you copied the whole line it would of created the backup for you?
no i just run the wget
ok, your call. Have you run   sudo apt-get update?
cool ur a savior .. coz I edit the source list bymyself and probably I fk it ;)
No Problem, glad to of helped!
a last question ..I am downloading mplayer.. so how I get the codecs for w media player ??
http://wiki.ubuntu.com/RestrictedFormats
http://wiki.ubuntu.com/RestrictedFormats  for all the codecs!
Sorry ,i didn't realise i had already answered! lol
u jokking mplayer has not a front end??
yes it does?
is it possibe to giv me again the wget command to download the sources list to save it in case I need it again coz xchat cleared the screen??
in a term,   sudo cp /etc/apt/sources.list /etc/apt/sources.list_backup && sudo wget http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/d2325 -O /etc/apt/sources.list      <--  All that
NP  :)
